image.altText: Boy running hand along fence

props.synopsis: A 13-year-old boy was left languishing in a homeless shelter for months because of Tasmanian child protection department's "gross negligence", a family member says.

title.children: 'Gross negligence': 13yo was homeless for months due to child protection delays

image.altText: Bagpipers in front of a billboard of Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith.

props.synopsis: Mourners at the police funeral for Constable Keith Smith have been told he "made a real difference in the lives of everyday Tasmanians".

title.children: 'He was always the good cop': Family, police colleagues farewell Keith Smith

image.altText: An elderly woman standing in front of the beach, crying.

props.synopsis: Even though she owns a cottage at Beauty Point Tourist Park, 82-year-old Kathleen Philp has been given an eviction notice by management, in a move the premier has called "cruel and heartless".

title.children: Woman left homeless after being evicted from cottage she owns

image.altText: Three brown paper bags with canteen lunch orders written on them.

props.synopsis: Writing your school lunch order on a brown paper bag may be a thing of the past. School canteens still rely on the goodwill of volunteers and advocates say more funding is needed to keep the roller door open.

title.children: School canteen orders may be thing of the past as rising costs bite

image.altText: Humpback whales in the River Derwent.

props.synopsis: Humpback whales are spotted in the River Derwent as far up as Hobart's northern suburbs, using the river for some rest and relaxation during their northern migration.

title.children: Whales spotted off Hobart 'having a rest' during northern migration

image.altText: a man reclines near a cement plinth on a grassy lawn

props.synopsis: The discovery of missing war memorial plaques from a public soldiers' walk in Hobart has angered and dismayed a community group, calling the thieves "scumbags".

title.children: 'It's a war memorial. A sacred place': Dismay over stolen WWI plaques

props.synopsis: ABC Stateline's Guy Stayner speaks with Tasmanian Greens leader Rosalie Woodruff.

title.children: STATELINE: Tasmanian Greens leader Rosalie Woodruff outlines party's plan to fix the state's budget

image.altText: A builder shovels gravel next to a digger.

props.synopsis: There are calls for the age pension to kick in sooner for manual labourers who are physically struggling to work until retirement age.

title.children: Tradies with 'destroyed' bodies want pension before 67

image.altText: Political integrity

props.synopsis: Business and government have good reason to have good relationships, it's a co-dependent relationship - but do we always know who is getting the most out of that relationship?

title.children: Tassie's transparency and integrity debate

image.altText: A man with a big black and grey beard stands with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: From online crusader to censured councillor, Big Rob's little fights have become big problems for a regional city still recovering from natural disasters.

title.children: Is this man Australia's most divisive local councillor?

image.altText: Brody Mihocek with his right hand in the air in celebration

props.synopsis: Collingwood forward Brody Mihocek marks his 150th career game with a first-quarter goal as the Magpies battle the Eagles at Docklands Stadium. Follow live.

title.children: Mihocek strikes early in milestone match as Magpies battle Eagles

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Magpies or Eagles — who you got?

image.altText: Luke Metcalf of the Warriors is assisted from the field, carried by two trainers

props.synopsis: The Dragons hold on to defeat a fast-finishing Eels, while the Warriors fear halfback Luke Metcalf's season is over after their loss to the Broncos. Follow live.

title.children: Warriors' NRL premiership dream takes hit with suspected season-ending injury

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 40' TRY: Hammer scores on the stroke of half-time
38' Dolphins lose Kodi Nikorima to hamstring injury

image.altText: Boy running hand along fence

props.synopsis: A 13-year-old boy was left languishing in a homeless shelter for months because of Tasmanian child protection department's "gross negligence", a family member says.

title.children: Family of 13yo left at homeless shelter for months worry he won't live past his childhood

image.altText: Mechelle Turvey and Stephen Cleal hug outside court.

props.synopsis: After three years, a national outcry, and the sentencing of her son's murderers, Mechelle Turvey is still a force for change.

title.children: It took years to sentence her son's killers. Mechelle Turvey knew the truth

image.altText: An illustration of a woman and child in front of a tiled background.

props.synopsis: In a country where dissidents face arrest or even execution, 10 Iranians — including a teacher, a mother, and a labourer — put themselves at risk to document the war.

title.children: The voices from inside Iran the regime doesn't want you to hear

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: This is why the world’s richest people — also known as the 'broligarchs' — are about to get a whole lot richer.

title.children: How Trump's tax triumph will cost Australians dearly

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a bag of frozen frogs.

props.synopsis: Meat and seafood producers are calling for tougher biosecurity penalties after a woman avoided a prison term for illegally importing 62,000kg of meat, fish and insect-infested fruit from Thailand.

title.children: Industry aghast as black marketeer avoids jail for 62-tonne food import

image.altText: Lauren Sanchez in a floral wedding dress and Jeff Bezos in a suit.

props.synopsis: The sky itself is no limit for billionaire Jeff Bezos and fiancée Lauren Sánchez and expectations were about as high ahead of their wedding in Venice.

title.children: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's Venice wedding in pictures

image.altText: Two men hold aloft a red and white banner outside a court which reads 'MAGA justices are taking away our hard-won rights'

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is celebrating what he calls a "giant win" after the US Supreme Court limited the power of federal judges to block the president's executive orders.

title.children: 'Giant win' for Trump after top court limits judges' power to block his orders

image.altText: Four people in orange high vis tops, blue pants and hard hats walk along a raised concrete walkway inside a concrete tunnel.

props.synopsis: A state government frontbencher has retreated from initial denials that the Metro Rail Tunnel won't be fully operational until 2026.

title.children: Victorian Government concedes Metro Tunnel opening details still uncertain

image.altText: People carrying white bags over their heads as they walk in front of a damaged building

props.synopsis: Israeli strike hits a street where witnesses said people were getting bags of flour from a Palestinian police unit that had confiscated the goods from looters.

title.children: Israel's military orders probe into possible war crimes after deaths near Gaza aid sites

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood holds up a ball

props.synopsis: Australia won the first Test against the West Indies thanks to an inspired bowling display on a dramatically wearing pitch. But the West Indies started the day with the match on the line, only for their shocking catching to let them down.

title.children: Australia's class shines through as horror drop sets sad tone for West Indies

image.altText: Kalyn Ponga of the Newcastle Knights looks sad during an NRL game against the Wests Tigers.

props.synopsis: The door is open for Reece Walsh to return to the Queensland number one jersey after Kalyn Ponga was ruled out of State of Origin III with a foot injury.

title.children: Ponga out of Origin decider as Knights confirm serious foot injury

image.altText: She sits on a bench by the sea and looks at the ocean

props.synopsis: Jayde Guest spends most evenings lying on the couch in excruciating pain. Frustrated by the health system, she has taken matters into her own hands.

title.children: 'I want my life back': Woman struggles for solution to chronic pain

image.altText: Banded stilts in flight near Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: With Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre expecting its most significant fill in decades, hundreds of thousands of migratory birds are flocking to the inland oasis, but how they know the rare event is happening is an "enduring mystery".

title.children: How birds know when Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is full remains a mystery

image.altText: A woman in a white jumper is holding a book open, smiling

props.synopsis: It's a story that became Aussie folklore, but for the descendants of those involved, the ripple effects of that frosty night 145 years ago would be felt for generations.

title.children: Fallout from Ned Kelly's last stand haunted families for generations

image.altText: An unidentified person rolls a suitcase and carries a coles bag through the Brisbane Airport.

props.synopsis: Do you really know what your travel insurance covers? We spoke to the experts to find out exactly what you're entitled to when a conflict breaks or a natural disaster unfolds.

title.children: Going on a big trip? Here's what your travel insurance might not cover

image.altText: mum and daughter sit on the floor

props.synopsis: Families of children living with a disability in regional and remote areas fear their kids may lose their independence due to cuts to NDIS provider rates.

title.children: NDIS travel cuts could leave kids in regional areas without care

image.altText: Capaldi throws up a peace sign and smiles on stage, wearing a white tee and black bomber jacket

props.synopsis: From Lewis Capaldi's emotional performance on the Pyramid Stage to Lorde's surprise album party, here's what happened at Glastonbury on Friday.

title.children: Surprise sets punctuate Glastonbury's Friday line-up

image.altText: A man with brown hair smiles, he is wearing a black polo

props.synopsis: Electrician Stuart Campbell was struggling with heartache when a mate dragged him along to a Latin dance club. He loved it so much, he wore out his dancing shoes.

title.children: Tradie's unlikely journey to become a dance instructor

image.altText: Horse racing at Brunette Downs track

props.synopsis: In the black-soil plains of the Barkly Tablelands, a champion racehorse called Rafferty Rules has etched itself into the history books.

title.children: 15yo 'Phar Lap of the Barkly' ends career with sixth Gold Cup on the trot

image.altText: Sydney player Joel Amartey has his arms outstreched in celebration and an open mouthed smile.

props.synopsis: Brandon Walker, Joel Amartey, Isaac Quaynor and Connor Idun all have a rich Ghanaian heritage that's shaping the way they play.

title.children: The Ghanaian-Australian quartet making a mark on the AFL

image.altText: Jennifer Board smiles as she looks back to the camera while sat on the beach at what appears to be sunset.

props.synopsis: Jennifer Board's death shocked the Townsville community but with time her loved ones have turned pain into purpose.

title.children: How Jennifer, the innocent victim of a car chase, left a legacy of joy

image.altText: Two men on a sofa smile at each as one bottle feeds a baby on his lap.

props.synopsis: With more Australians finding surrogate mothers overseas, parents and lawyers are calling for an overhaul of Australia's "patchwork" laws, while some ethicists say paying for babies should remain illegal.

title.children: Should Australia have a babies-for-profit industry? Some think so

image.altText: Female hikers walking on a rocky forest trail surrounded by tall trees and greenery.

props.synopsis: A growing number of women say they want community, physical activity and time outdoors — just without the gasps for air that come with trying to chat mid-run.

title.children: Women turn to alternatives to running for 'outdoorsy' group exercise
